reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Poor service from reception on various occasions. There was only 1 receptionist at the time when there were multiple guests wanting to check in, which wasn't too bad but we hardly felt welcome by her attitude and unwillingless to explain things when we asked her questions (e.g. availability of internet). We also had to change rooms because the air conditioning wasn't functioning at first. The rooms were otherwise fine and fairly comfortable. Very nice building but very much let down by the service.
reviews.title: Nice hotel poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.text: A few good things: location, nice lobby, nice patio, generally nice common areas.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Personnel was ok to good, with a notable exception of one very rude and arrogant receptionist.
reviews.title: Poor service and very tired rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room and bathroom: ours were in urgent need of refurbishing: chipped wood on doors, musty bathroom wall tiles, broken floor tiles, ripped bedsheets, curtain rail hanging loose, ...
reviews.title: Comfortable, pleasant but characterless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful boutique hotel located in the heart of old Seville. The rooms are fairly spacious (ours had a very nice balcony) and very well done. The lobby, though smallish, is also very nice. There is a wonderful sitting area for drinks in the back and a lovely dining area on the roof though, given it was January, we did not use either. The service, in particular the attitude, was inconsistent, a shame given how nice everything else was. Price wise, the hotel was very reasonable, a real bargain for what you got, accommodation wise. Oddly, they did tell my wife that breakfast was 70 euros (even pointed to it on the computer when she expressed surprise); perhaps you could bargain them down!
reviews.title: Beautiful and Great Value, attitude not so much
Beautiful Lobby, Great Location
reviews.text: I stayed with a friend for a two night stay in Seville. The hotel was clean and the bathroom was very nice with double sinks and a nice full size bath tub. We didn't have much of a view but the beds were comfortable and the room was quiet. We didn't spend much time in the room as the city is so fun. The breakfast was very nice and it is served in a beautiful room. The staff was very helpful with adjusting the breakfast price because I am gluten free and couldn't eat most of the food on the buffet. The price was great. The hotel is a good choice, you won't be disappointed.
The locaton of the hotel is fine when you finally know how to walk the streets and side streets of Seville.
reviews.title: Overall conclusion: the hotel was ok but not great. This is obviously not a 4 star hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the bathroom was clearly outdated and worn out; you could see the maggots in the wooden furniture. There was a huge crack in the bedroom ceiling present; which suggests that the room clearly needed to be fixed up. Some useful amenities were missing in the room; such as hot water kettle (tea/coffee, tall mirror and an iron board/flatiron. These should be standard items in a room. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel because it was too expensive (16 euro).
reviews.title: Winter weekend in Sevilla

reviews.text: I do believe that Seville is a great city but I wasn't impressed by the hotel.
reviews.title: Simply awesome!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: fairytale hotel with a typical Andalusian inner yard.
reviews.title: fairytale

reviews.text: the room was absolutely charming, with a huge bathroom and a very comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for a family city break - somehting special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel that I´ll definately return to!
reviews.title: Only average with a few disasters

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want authentic Spanish style and a touch of elegance yet a friendly hotel this is ideal. The staff couldn't have been more helpful - we had two excellent rooms with one for early teenage children close to our room. Both rooms were spacious, well-equipped and very clean. Reception helped us hire bikes (and it was a bit of a hassle finding one small enough for a 10 year old but they persevered), recommended restaurants and weere generally obliging. We enjoyed the downstairs courtyard and reception areas where there were plenty of sofas and tables to take a drink or coffee. Lovely atmosphere and very central without being on an inaccessible noisy street. So quiet we slept late but within 10 minutes we were in front of the Cathedral. Nowhere is far in Seville!
reviews.title: nice place good location , service could have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked in without reservation. Very expensive for facilities. 275 euros for a double room without breakfast. Nice bed. No bath. No smoking. No free Internet. Expensive minibar. Car parking available in underground car park which was accessible by valet. Took car and they returned keys to us and were tipped. Next morning car keys nowhere to be found. Spent an hour searching all our belongings and the room. Eventually asked at reception and told that they had the keys which must have been retrieved from our room. After breakfast checked out and asked for car. Told it would be a few minutes....however the car park lift had broken down! A bit fed up. About an hour later, car arrived.
reviews.title: Great Location, hit and miss service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every bit of a true 4 star hotel, staff, food, rooms and great location!
reviews.title: Great true 4 star hotel!

reviews.text: Lovely ambiance, terrific staff, great location for exploring Seville and taking in a bullfight (!), but we woke up itchy ... with a few bite marks! Why??? Lost an iTouch ... How??? I don't really want to know. Good option, but be on your guard!
reviews.title: Great location, good service, nice loft family rooms ... but

reviews.text: We stayed at La Rabida for two nights. We found the hotel through tripadvisor and had a satisfactory experience. It is a beautiful hotel, with a very nice lobby and rooftop terrace. Our rooms, however, were just okay, a little small and it tended to be noisy, as one could hear everything from the hallways. The AC did not work well and it was hot and stuffy at night.
reviews.title: Great location, average service!
